intro: Oldenlandia diffusa var. extensa, commonly known as the spreading spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value.
